title: THE ITALO NON-STOP MEGAMIX (BEST SONGS SELECTED)
description:
THE ITALO NON-STOP MEGAMIX (BEST SONGS SELECTED)




::::.. Tired of downloading another Italo album, to find out that there ..:::
::::.. are only a few nice songs on it? Let's face it, unfortunately there ..:::
::::.. is produced a lot of crap in the Italo scene. ..:::


BUT WAIT.. Now you have finally found the right mix!!!!


:::.. All the hot sweet Italo songs from the eighties are carefully ..:::
:::.. selected for this fast GRAND MIX! The songs are selected in a way ..:::
:::.. they all fit together coherently, and the 43 songs are fluently ..:::
:::.. mixed in 95 minutes. ..:::
:::.. After all it is a mix that demands to be heard!! ..:::

WHAT IS ITALO ?


SOURCE: Ishkur's Guide to Electronic Music

There was a big backlash to everything Disco in America in 1980.
In Europe, this didn't happen, so Disco naturally progressed over
there to what it had been hinting at for several years: a stripped
down, mechanical version of itself dubbed Italo Disco for reasons
unknown as very few of the artists were actual Italians. But they
all sang in english, which is odd because english was universally
a second language to them, as evidenced by the fact that the lyrics
make no sense and the vocalists have thick accents of indeterminate
origin. Still, despite these shortcomings, the music kicks ass, and
is recognized as the world's first completely electronic commercial
dance music, predating House, Techno, Electro, and just about
everything else. The music is seriously stupid good fun once you get
past its dated, tinny sound. I now have ten times more of this music
than any other genre. And I might very well start spinning it too.
No, I'm serious. You don't believe me, do you?
